consent.title: Informed Consent Form
consent.helper: If any term is unclear, try reading in another language.
paragraphs: You are invited to participate in the research “Quality Promotion Practices in Game Development: An Observational Study”, conducted by Esdras Caleb Oliveira Silva (lead researcher) and Lyrene Fernandes da Silva (supervisor).
This research is intended exclusively for people aged 18 or older who work in digital game development.
We seek to identify ways to integrate automated testing practices into game development, especially in the context of independent teams.
If you decide to participate, you will answer 34 questions about your profile as a game developer, the software engineering practices you use, and the types of tests employed in game validation.
The estimated time to answer all questions is 15 minutes.

Risks, Confidentiality, and Benefits:
Your participation involves minimal risks. The main risk is fatigue while answering the questionnaire, which is minimized by the option to save your answers and continue later. As this is an online survey, there are risks associated with the virtual environment. To protect your information, we, the researchers, have adopted the following measures:
  • Data Collection: Your answers will be anonymous. We will collect your browser language and form language. Providing your email is optional and will only be used if you wish to participate in a follow-up interview. Emails will be stored separately from survey responses.
  • Security: We assume responsibility for storing all data in a secure digital environment with restricted access.
Benefits: Indirectly, your contribution will generate knowledge for the game development community.

Right to Refuse and Withdraw Consent:
In compliance with the General Data Protection Law (LGPD), you may refuse to participate or withdraw at any time, without needing to justify and without any penalty. To ensure your right to request data removal even after anonymous submission, upon finishing the questionnaire, you will receive a unique identification code. Keep this code. If you decide in the future that your data should no longer be used in the research, simply contact us and provide the code so your response can be deleted from our database.

In case of doubts, please contact:
Esdras Caleb Oliveira Silva – SEDIS/UFRN
Email: acheicaleb@gmail.com
Phone: +55 (84) 99688-8803

The provided data will be stored for 5 years. Ethical questions can be clarified with the Research Ethics Committee of UFRN (CEP Central/UFRN):

It is also possible to contact the National Research Ethics Commission (Conep):

common.required_one_option: Please select at least one option.

survey.country_work: In which country do you primarily work/act in game development?
survey.formacao: What is your highest level of education?
survey.area_formacao: What is the field of your highest degree?

area_formacao_o.computacao: Computer Science, Information Systems, and Software-Focused Engineering (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Telecommunications, Networking)
area_formacao_o.autodidata: Self-taught (no formal education in the field)

survey.anos_experiencia: How many years have you been working in digital game development?
survey.qtd_projetos: How many game projects (released or not) have you worked on?
survey.situacao: Currently, which type of role do you spend most of your time on in digital game development? (Consider where you actually work the most hours, even if you have more than one type of role.)

situacao_o.atuacao_industria_integral: I work full-time at a game industry company
situacao_o.atuacao_industria_parcial: I work part-time at a game industry company
situacao_o.atuacao_freelancer: I develop games as a freelancer/contractor regularly
situacao_o.atuacao_indie_horas_vagas: I develop independent games in my spare time (hobbyist/unpaid or occasional revenue)
situacao_o.atuacao_eventual: I develop games occasionally, in one-off or collaborative projects (e.g., Game Jams)

survey.situacao_equipe: In most of the projects you are currently involved in, how is the game development team structured? (Consider the type of team you spend the most time working with.)

situacao_equipe_o.pequena: In a Small Team (2 to 15 people)
situacao_equipe_o.media: In a Medium Team (15 to 60 people)
situacao_equipe_o.grande: In a Large Team (60 to 120 people)
situacao_equipe_o.muito_grande: In a Very Large Team (120+ people)
situacao_equipe_o.varia: Varia bastante de projeto para projeto
situacao_equipe_o.nao_participa: I work independently and do not have direct contact with the project team

survey.duracao_projetos: On average, what is the duration of the projects you participate in?
survey.funcoes: What roles/functions do you usually perform?
survey.tipos_jogos: What types of games do you develop most?
survey.plataformas_desenvolvimento: For which platforms do you usually develop games?
survey.ferramentas_desenvolvimento: Which engines do you usually use in the projects you work on (or have worked on)?

ferramentas_desenvolvimento_options.propria_corporativa: Custom Engine (Proprietary, made by the company)
ferramentas_desenvolvimento_options.nada: I do not use game engines (programming with basic libs like SDL)

survey.uso_praticas_padroes_design: Code best practices (e.g., SOLID, KISS, DRY, Clean Code)
survey.uso_praticas_modelagem_projeto: Project modeling (e.g., flowcharts, state diagrams, etc.)

uso_praticas.label: For each of the practices below, select the option that best represents your experience in game development.

opcoes.sempre_uso: It is core to my workflow
opcoes.nao_conhece: I don't use it because I don't know it well
opcoes.nao_util: I don't see the utility for my projects
opcoes.ja_tentou: I tried using it, but found it complicated or overkill
opcoes.prefere_outros: I prefer to focus on other areas of development

survey.dificuldades_manutencao: In your experience, what makes project evolution and maintenance most difficult over time? (Choose up to 3 options)

dificuldades_manutencao_o.codigo_dificil: Code becomes difficult to understand over time
dificuldades_manutencao_o.mudancas_quebram: Making changes causes unexpected errors in other parts of the game (regressions)
dificuldades_manutencao_o.prazo_curto: Lack of time or tight deadlines
dificuldades_manutencao_o.mudancas_escopo: Changes in scope or features in the middle of the project
dificuldades_manutencao_o.sem_boas_praticas: Absence of good software engineering practices
dificuldades_manutencao_o.sem_dificuldades: I do not face significant difficulties in this aspect

survey.testes_jogo: What forms of testing do you usually use to verify if the game is working correctly?

testes_jogo_options.exploratorio: Exploratory testing — I play freely and observe if there are glitches or strange behaviors
testes_jogo_options.roteiro: Scripted testing — I follow a list of steps or a checklist to verify specific features
testes_jogo_options.automatizado: Automated testing — I use tools or scripts to test parts of the game without manual intervention
testes_jogo_options.agentes: Simulated agents — I use bots or scripts that mimic player behavior to test the game

survey.dificuldades_testes: If you have tried using automated tests, what were the main difficulties? (Select the top 3)

dificuldades_testes_options.entendimento_frameworks: Difficulty understanding how testing tools work.
dificuldades_testes_options.integracao_dificil: Complication integrating tests into the project workflow.
dificuldades_testes_options.preferencia_humanos: The feeling that manual tests are more practical or efficient.
dificuldades_testes_options.criacao_dificil: Difficult to develop and keep the tests up-to-date.
dificuldades_testes_options.nao_encontram_erros_reais: Perception that automated tests do not find the "bugs that matter".
dificuldades_testes_options.nunca_usei: I have never tried using automated tests.

survey.ferramentas_teste: Which tools have you used to create automated tests in your game projects?

ferramentas_teste_options.godot_tests: A Godot Test Framework Plugin (e.g., GUT or gdUnit)
ferramentas_teste_options.nenhuma: I have never used automated testing tools

survey.conteudo_testado: Which aspects of the game do you usually cover in automated tests?

conteudo_testado_options.componentes: Isolated components — I verify if specific parts of the code work correctly independently (Unit Testing)
conteudo_testado_options.performance: Basic performance — I evaluate load times, frame rate (FPS), or resource consumption
conteudo_testado_options.cenarios: Specific game scenarios — I simulate gameplay situations to check if the game responds as expected
conteudo_testado_options.teste_fumaca: Smoke tests — I only check if the game starts and runs without critical crashes
conteudo_testado_options.simulacao: Simulation — I simulate a player's behavior through an agent
conteudo_testado_options.nao_uso: I do not use automated tests

survey.tipo_falha: In the games you develop, which problems do you prioritize avoiding? (Choose up to 3)

tipo_falha_options.stuck: Stuck — player gets stuck without being able to exit (Softlock)
tipo_falha_options.crash: Crash — game closes, freezes, or hangs
tipo_falha_options.visual_multimidia: Visual glitches or strange audio noises
tipo_falha_options.balanceamento: Game balance outside the planned level (too easy, too hard, or inconsistent)

survey.etapa_testes: At what stage of development are automated tests created?

etapa_testes_options.antes_funcionalidade: Before implementing the feature — I follow a test-driven approach (Test-Driven Development)
etapa_testes_options.durante_funcionalidade: During or right after implementing the feature — I write tests along with the code
etapa_testes_options.pos_prototipo: After creating a functional prototype — I test when I already have something playable or testable
etapa_testes_options.final: Only at the end of the project, during the review phase
etapa_testes_options.nunca: I do not use automated tests
etapa_testes_options.quando_possivel: When there is time or opportunity — without a defined step in the process

survey.requisito_testes: In which situations are automated tests used as a mandatory requirement in your projects?

requisito_testes_options.atualizacao: To accept contributions from collaborators (e.g., pull requests)
requisito_testes_options.proxima_fase: To allow the project to advance to the next phase (alpha, beta)
requisito_testes_options.nova_funcionalidade: To start the development of a new feature
requisito_testes_options.nunca: They are not a mandatory requirement in projects

survey.avaliacao_artefatos: How do you usually evaluate the quality of the creative artifacts you produce (images, sounds, icons, videos, layouts, etc.)?

avaliacao_artefatos_o.criterios_definidos: I use previously defined criteria (e.g., style, clarity, audience suitability)
avaliacao_artefatos_o.avaliacao_subjetiva: I rely on informal or subjective evaluation, without a structured evaluation process
avaliacao_artefatos_o.testes_formais: I perform formal tests with users or specific tools
avaliacao_artefatos_o.avaliacao_por_outros: The evaluation is done mainly by other people on the team

survey.design_validacao: How do you usually test or evaluate your design before full implementation?

design_validacao_options.prototipo_simplificado: Through simplified playable prototypes (digital or analog)
design_validacao_options.prototipo_real: With physical or real-world simulations (e.g., with people, objects, role-playing)
design_validacao_options.excel: Using spreadsheets to simulate systems or balancing
design_validacao_options.mental: I mentally simulate scenarios and interactions
design_validacao_options.nenhum: I usually implement directly without prior design validation.

survey.areas_uso_ia: How have you been using generative AIs (ChatGPT, Copilot, Midjourney, etc.) in game development?

areas_uso_ia_o.ideias_criativas: To generate creative ideas (e.g., characters, mechanics, narratives, dialogues)
areas_uso_ia_o.conteudo_visual_sonoro: To create visual or audio content (e.g., concept art, voices, soundtracks, effects)
areas_uso_ia_o.implementacao: To assist in implementation (e.g., writing or reviewing code, suggesting technical solutions)
areas_uso_ia_o.planejamento: To plan or structure the game (e.g., documentation, system architecture, balancing)
areas_uso_ia_o.testes: To create or suggest automated tests (e.g., generating test cases, validation scripts)
areas_uso_ia_o.validacao: To review or validate game features (e.g., finding bugs, checking logic)
areas_uso_ia_o.ainda_nao_usei: I haven't used AI yet, but I am curious or interested
areas_uso_ia_o.nao_usarei: I do not use AI in my game projects and do not intend to.

survey.percepcao_uso_ia: What are your main concerns about the use of generative AIs in the field? (Select up to 3 options)

percepcao_uso_ia_options.etica_dados: Unauthorized use of data and ethical issues (copyright, authorship, credits, plagiarism)
percepcao_uso_ia_options.privacidade: Privacy concerns: my inputs might be reused without control
percepcao_uso_ia_options.substituicao: Fear that professionals in the field will be replaced by AI
percepcao_uso_ia_options.confiabilidade_transparencia: Lack of transparency and difficulty verifying the originality or reliability of what AI produces
percepcao_uso_ia_options.etica: Ethics in AI use (e.g., authorship, credits, plagiarism)
percepcao_uso_ia_options.sem_preocupacoes: I have no significant concerns at the moment

survey.any_comment: Your experience and perception are fundamental to this research. Use the space below to add comments, suggestions, or reflections on how testing is performed in the game projects you participate in.
survey.email_contato: Leave your email if you are willing to be contacted for an interview about testing in game development.
